Very few games are as perfect as Half-Life. Considering the substantial success that Valve relishes in today, it's not surprising that their first effort to enter the gaming market was an instant hit. Heavily inspired by id Software's Doom and Quake games, Half-Life is a perfect blend of 90s and modern first-person-shooter. Anyone who proudly calls themselves a gamer MUST have played this game at least once - especially considering that it's an easily affordable product on Steam that is still updated by Valve even twenty years later. 
This is often cited as one of the earliest F.P.S games (back then they were called "Doom clones") that had actual plot, complete with characters, dialogue and setting. As old as it is, the story is very well-detailed and sets off a chain of events that only escalates further down the line. 
Even with the dated graphics, the game still looks brilliant today and can run at 60fps, with loading screens that always last no more than a single second. Valve games seem to maintain a pattern of focussing more on gameplay rather than on cutscenes, and it's no surprise that Half-Life did so well at telling a story without ever taking the player out of the immersion of the infamous silent protagonist: Gordon Freeman. 
As for those of you who prefer multiplayer action over single player, Half-Life also offers a deathmatch mode which, incredibly, still has players clogging the lobbies even today. There is no ranking system, and despite its rather bland design, it's an appreciated addition to a game that didn't even need it. 
I am not exaggerating when I say that this game is pretty much the sole reason for Steam's very existence. Without it, Valve would never have gotten off the ground and we would live in a world absent of Portal, Left 4 Dead, Team Fortress, Counter-Strike, and so on. 
So, do not be intimidated by the fact that this game is from 1998. You'll be surprised at how well it holds up and how tight the controls are. If you want to explore Valve's roots that made them the game-changers that they are (or rather, were) today, then download Half-Life, pick up that crowbar and start whacking the hell out of everything. You won't be disappointed. 
Time to choooose.

Um ótimo FPS pra sua época, bem longo e diffícil. Se você quer uma nova experiência sem exigir muito se tratanto de mecânicas ou gráficos atuais vai nessa, se você for impaciente ou costumar ficar preso em partes específicas em jogos, não deixe de ver os vídeos de walkthrough do BigMacDavis no Youtube, são muito bons pra ajudar novos players!

ok, so. I finally got able to edit my "review " after all these years. And I'm gonna say almost the exact same thing, except, I'm gonna really write the "REVIEW" about this game. My lovely game.

Khm. So, the first thing I wanna to mention is the graphical design in this game. It's so good that I even can't explain why. The whole game is kind dark and slippery, it really get you this atmopshere of the incident and all that stuff. The second thing is sound desing. In my opinion, this is the most unique sound desing that I've ever encountered. It totally fits the whole game. Voice acting is good, too (for 1998 game ofc xddd). The third thing is the engine, this game was created in. Goldsrc takes place from the original IDTech1, by ID Software. The first Quake was made in it. This engine, ofc, is now just outdated, but... but, just look, what people are creating for it. There's so much mods and modding-platforms for this game. This engine gave me the start in modding, and maybe game-dev in the future (not promoting myself xdd).

That's pretty much I wanted to say, thank you VALVe, for this amazing, legendary game. Thank you so much.

Nostalgia from playing this is just wonderful. Sometimes some puzzles are unclear to what you have to do to overcome them (the entity inside the rocket chamber took me a while to realise that it listened to sound) and I remember one or 2 were outright hard (getting on top of the barrels in the toxic river then getting onto he pipe). It's amazing to see how far we have come with vidya development tho. Don't walk into the game thinking "ez game must beat" go into it with interest and to observe old valve games as if it'd just been released.
Love it.
MUHTEŞEM !

Una verdadera joya de los FPS. Siempre había oído hablar de este título, y hace tiempo lo jugue pero muy poco. Hace unos días me lo compré y me dispusé a pasarmelo en difícil, y madre mía. Hace relativamente poco me pasé por primera vez el Dark Souls, y me río de las muertes del Dark Souls, en Half Life en modo difícil he muerto infinidad de veces, y os voy a decir por qué. Porque la IA de este juego es una pasada, los aliens son unos verdaderos hijos de puta, los militares estan más chetados que un puto hacker y te hacen desquiciarte, pero a esto sólo le veo cosas buenas, ya que es un juego que te plantea gran reto. 
Si sólo quieres pasartelo y disfrutar de la historia y juego excelente, póntelo en normal, pero si quieres quebrarte la cabeza y medir cada paso que des, ponlo en difícil y prepara el culo. 
Por último decir lo único malo que he experimentado en el juego, y ha sido el movimiento del personaje, aunque ya estaba acostumbrado un poco, ya que diría que es un movimiento parecido al del Counter Strike 1.6, al haber tanto plataformeo 3D igual he muerto las mismas veces por los enemigos que por caídas, pero bueno, le da un plus a la dificultad.
This game is legendary: simply put. It should be viewed as a role-model for all future FPS games.

Jedna z Najlepszych Gier w Jaką Kiedykolwiek Grałem. Grafika Jak Na Swoje Czasy Była Oszałamiająca. Valve Się Naprawdę Przyłożył. Są Tylko Dwie Irytujące Rzeczy w Tej Grze. Jak Ma Się Mało HP i Wszyscy Cię Biorą Na Hita (Pokonałem Pierwszego Bossa Mając 1 HP) i Glitchowanie Się w Ścianie. Najwięcej Się Denerwowałem Przy Walce z Nihilanthem, Bo Miałem Jakiegoś Buga, Że Był Nieśmiertelny.

Plusy:
-Grafika 10/10
-Fajna Rozgrywka
-Klimat
-Fajne Levele
-Fajny Pomysł Na Grę
-Fajni Wrogowie

Minusy:
-Glitche (Można Je Wybaczyć, Ponieważ Ta Gra Ma 20 Lat)

Ciekawostka: Gdy Powstał Mod Do Half-Life'a Pt. Half-Life: Counter-Strike Cieszył Się Tak Dużą Popularnością, Że Powstała Odrębna Seria.
Wniosek: Gdyby Nie Half-Life To By Nie Było CS'a.

Gra Otrzymuje Ocenę: 10/10
It's... [i]good[/i]?

well i just beat this old classic and its had many ups and a few downs along the way. 

--Short Version--

-Satisfying guns

-some pretty cool small details

-fun multiplayer.

-an okay story

-vey buggy sometimes gamebreaking. 

--Long Version--

One of the thing i noticed first about this old game is its attention to detail. stepping on cockroaches squishes them. theres a bunch of small interactions you can completely miss if your not exploring everything. like how you can mess up the microwaves and how soda machines actually give you hp. then there are other things like seeing the horrible deaths of certain scientists and guards that you can just completely miss if you are not paying attention. 

another awesome thing about this game is the guns. the shotgun is just amazing. theres nothing like getting right in an enemies face and alt firing two shells directly into a dudes face. super satisfying! a couple of really interesting guns too. like the super death laser gun that you can charge up to kill some of the bigger enemies in ONE SHOT. Then theres the other gun that me and my freinds describe as the "Ghostbuster Gun". Oh man and that revolver is just great too. super acurrate , kills most enemies in 2 shots , and i mean cmon revolvers are just cool in general. all the guns in this game are pretty great in one way or another and feel great. 

The multiplayer is pretty simple to get into and fun as well. you respawn instantly so dont need to wait for long to get back into the action. all the guns from singleplayer are somewhere on the map. i will say some of the bigger maps feel too big for small groups of freinds tho.

Some of my major complaints here is mostly the bugs. along the way through the whole game my character just gets stuck on things. alot of times it happens when its loading the next part of the map. other times i get stuck on a lever im standing too close to when i pull it. also had one weird instance weird if i touched a body on a moving elevator it just instantly killed me. and i had one major super gamebreaking bug. putting spoiler tag cause it involves a pretty late part of the game. [spoiler] so in gonarchs lair during that boss fight the creature is meant to at one point jump into a hole. and then go down onto its web thing. well for about a half hour i tried to fight the monster while it did not do this. needless to say it was frustratring. i couldnt really kill it even if i used all my ammo. and if i stayed near it instead of jumping down below the web it would just kill me. the boss was unbeatable and wouldnt die untill i reloaded an earlier save. [/spoiler]

The story is well gordon freeman just having a really bad day while everyone keeps telling him to go and do stuff cause hes the only one capable of doing anything [spoiler] during the resonace cascade thats making alien bug people randomly teleport in everywhere. oh and then a weird guy with a briefcase asks you if you want to work for him. [/spoiler]  Which is allright i guess. most of my fun came from just wondering who hell designed the various facilities and maintenance shafts with zero regard for human safety rather than the story itself.

[h1] [b]HALF-LIFE[/b] - CLASSICAL REVERENCE [/h1]

[b]+[/b] Immaculately constructed scifi-horror narrative
[b]+[/b] Empowering level design that constantly challenges the player with new problems
[b]+[/b] Diverse weapon arsenal
[b]+[/b] iconic soundscape creates oppressive survival atmosphere
[b]+[/b] The G-Man

[b]-[/b] Aggravating fall damage
[b]-[/b] Xen is an unpolished, poorly designed mess
[b]-[/b] Puzzling weapon progression

21337

"Half-Life" is an awesome game and deserves all the praise it has recieved over the years. The gameplay is fun and the story is well-written. I played the game on the hardest difficulty, and obviously, the enemies were at times challenging to defeat, particularly the soldiers. But you get plenty of ammo and health throughout the game, and you just have to play smart. My only criticisms are that the game goes on for too long, and that some of the puzzles are hard to solve. The game starts on a great note, with the player becoming immersed in the world they are in. However, the game loses some steam in around the middle. Levels like "Power Up" and "On A Rail"  became tedious with constant backtracking and not knowing where to go next. Luckily, the game regains it's momentum with the following levels. Chapters 12-14 in particular, are the highlights of the game. Though they aren't as interesting as the preceding chapters, the Xen levels are still playable and they culminate in a satisfying conclusion to a great game. Half-Life is one of the best FPS games I have ever played, along with "DOOM", and definitely better than "Call Of Duty". If the graphics don't hold up for you (For me, they did), try out "Black Mesa", a remake of this game with MUCH better graphics. If you haven't ever played "Half-Life", play it!

Motivi per cui Half life è un capolavoro

- Narrativa silenziosa. Al giorno d'oggi è la prassi che in un FPS di stampo narrativo (anche quelli che ritengo dei capolavori, come la saga di Bioshock) tutto ci venga spiegato da tutti. NPC che parlano, blocchi di testi da leggere ecc. Tutto ciò ovviamente è molto bello, ma è molto più arduo narrare una storia con poche parole, pochi dialoghi e poche scritte. Half-life ci riesce.  La stessa regia ( come quella relativa alla sequenza di introduzione a Black Mesa) è un grande espediente per instaurare nella mente del giocatore degli elmenti su cui dedurre dove ci troviamo, chi siamo e cosa si fa in questo luogo.

- Ironia. Il primo Half-life, al contrario del secondo, è un gioco che non si prende troppo sul serio. L'ironia è sottile e comprende figure come quella degli scienziati, dei militari e delle figure governative. Un chiaro esempio di ciò è la sequenza di intro a black mesa: mentre la voce pre-registrata del vagone in cui ci troviamo spiega detagliatamente le norme di sicurezza e raccomandazioni relative, assistiamo ad un enorme perdita di materiale radioattivo gestita malamente in una zona di transito.
